item.title: 奈飞营收超预期，用户数达3.25亿
item.description: 奈飞公司周二表示，其假日季度营收超出华尔街预期，订阅用户数突破3.25亿。【原文：Netflix exceeded ​Wall Street's revenue estimates for its holiday quarter, as it crossed 325 million ‌subscribers, the company said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 彭博社报道，GoldenTree将收购约2亿美元的萨克斯全球破产融资。
item.description: 彭博新闻周二援引知情人士消息报道，全球资产管理公司GoldenTree将收购奢侈品零售商Saks Global价值10亿美元破产融资中的一部分。【原文：Global asset ​management firm GoldenTree will ‌buy a chunk of a $1 billion bankruptcy financing for luxury retailer Saks Global, Bloomberg News ‌reported on Tuesday, citing ​people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 五角大楼称，美国国务院批准向新加坡出售价值23亿美元的飞机和鱼雷
item.description: 美国国务院已批准向新加坡出售海上巡逻侦察机、轻型鱼雷及相关装备，这笔交易价值约23亿美元，五角大楼周二宣布。【原文：The U.S. State Department has approved the potential sale of maritime patrol and reconnaissance aircraft and lightweight torpedoes and related equipment to Singapore in a deal valued at an estimated $2.3 billion, the Pentagon said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 彭博社报道称，黑石集团正考虑以50亿美元出售Beacon Offshore公司
item.description: 彭博社周二援引知情人士消息报道，黑石集团正就出售旗下Beacon Offshore Energy公司进行谈判，该公司在美国墨西哥湾运营油气资产，交易金额可能超过50亿美元。【原文：Blackstone is in talks to sell its Beacon Offshore Energy, which operates oil and gas assets in the U.S. Gulf of Mexico for more than $5 billion, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会将就Meta反垄断案中涉及Instagram和WhatsApp收购的裁决提起上诉
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会发言人周二表示，该机构将提起上诉，试图重启其指控Facebook母公司Meta Platforms通过收购Instagram和WhatsApp来巩固非法垄断地位的案件。【原文：The U.S. Federal Trade Commission will file an appeal seeking to revive its case accusing Facebook parent company Meta Platforms of bolstering an illegal monopoly by acquiring Instagram and WhatsApp, the FTC's spokesperson said on Tuesday.】

item.title: OpenAI在ChatGPT上推出年龄预测功能
item.description: OpenAI周二宣布，将在全球范围内推出ChatGPT年龄预测功能，用于判断账户是否可能由未成年人持有。这家人工智能初创企业正准备允许其热门聊天机器人显示成人内容。【原文：OpenAI on Tuesday said it is rolling out age prediction on ChatGPT globally, to determine whether an account is likely owned by a minor, as the artificial intelligence startup prepares to allow adult content on the popular chatbot.】

item.title: 谷歌支持的人工智能药物研发初创公司Isomorphic Labs推迟临床试验时间表
item.description: Isomorphic Labs公司创始人兼首席执行官德米斯·哈萨比斯周二表示，这家利用人工智能进行药物研发的企业预计将在2026年底前启动首批临床试验。【原文：Isomorphic Labs, which uses artificial intelligence for drug discovery, expects to have its first clinical trials by the end of 2026, founder and CEO Demis Hassabis said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 露露乐蒙因投诉暂停新款健身系列"Get Low"线上销售
item.description: 运动服饰制造商露露柠檬周二表示，因用户投诉，已暂停名为"Get Low"的新健身系列产品的线上销售。【原文：Athletic wear maker Lululemon Athletica said on Tuesday it had paused online sales of a new workout line called "Get Low" after user complaints.】

item.title: 特拉华州最高法院就股东协议案支持莫里斯公司
item.description: 特拉华州最高法院周二裁定，莫里斯公司股东无权质疑与创始人肯·莫里斯达成的协议——该协议赋予其对这家投资银行董事会广泛的控制权。【原文：A Moelis & Co shareholder cannot challenge an agreement with Ken Moelis that gives the founder broad control over the investment bank's board, the Delaware Supreme Court ruled on Tuesday.】

item.title: 法官裁定卡尔希不得在马萨诸塞州运营体育预测市场
item.description: 马萨诸塞州一名法官周二裁定，预测市场运营商卡尔希不得允许该州居民通过其在线平台进行体育博彩。此前该州总检察长指控其违反博彩监管规定。【原文：A Massachusetts judge on Tuesday ruled prediction-markets operator Kalshi cannot let state residents bet on sports through its online platform, after the state's attorney general accused it of running afoul of gaming regulators.】

item.title: 穆巴达拉首席执行官表示，该公司正瞄准人工智能和机器人领域的机遇。
item.description: 阿布扎比主权财富基金穆巴达拉周二表示，正瞄准人工智能和机器人领域的投资机遇，将这些领域视为工业增长的主要来源和未来投资的指南。【原文：Abu Dhabi sovereign wealth fund Mubadala is targeting opportunities in artificial intelligence and robotics, viewing the sectors as a major source of industrial growth and a guide for future investments, its group CEO said on Tuesday.】

item.title: Moncler最大股东鲁菲尼将把CEO职位移交给即将离任的Bottega Veneta掌门人
item.description: 意大利奢侈户外服装集团Moncler周二宣布，其主要股东雷莫·鲁菲尼将于4月1日卸任首席执行官职务，由现任Bottega Veneta掌门人巴托洛梅奥·荣格内接任。【原文：Italian luxury outerwear group Moncler said on Tuesday its main shareholder Remo Ruffini was leaving the role of chief executive officer from April 1, to be replaced by Bartolomeo Rongone, currently at the helm of Bottega Veneta.】

item.title: 卢特尼克预计美国第一季度经济增长将超过5%，并警告欧盟不要采取报复措施。
item.description: 美国商务部长霍华德·卢特尼克周二表示，预计2026年第一季度美国国内生产总值（GDP）增速将超过5%，并指出当前利率水平过高，正抑制经济更强劲的增长。【原文：U.S. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said on Tuesday he expected first quarter GDP growth in the United States would exceed 5% in the first quarter of 2026, adding that its interest rates were too high and were holding back stronger growth.】

item.title: 欧洲领导人坚守达沃斯立场，企业高管情绪化警告
item.description: 欧洲领导人因特朗普最新全球战略而感到不安，正寻求在达沃斯论坛展现团结姿态。与此同时，企业高管们警告称，面对美国总统吞并格陵兰岛的野心，切忌情绪化回应。【原文：European leaders, rattled by Donald Trump's latest global gambit, are looking to present a united front in Davos, as CEOs warned against an emotional response to the U.S. president's ambition to take over Greenland.】

item.title: 雅诗兰黛被美妆科技初创公司控告涉嫌窃取技术
item.description: 雅诗兰黛被一家自称"颠覆性"的初创企业起诉，该企业指控这家化妆品巨头窃取其技术以提升酒店内环球旅行者的消费额，导致其实质上被挤出市场。【原文：Estee Lauder was sued by a self-described "disruptive" startup that accused the cosmetics giant of effectively putting it out of business by stealing technology to boost sales from jet-setting travelers in hotels.】

item.title: 比特币囤积者策略八天内购入21.3亿美元比特币
item.description: 亿万富翁迈克尔·赛勒尔旗下专注比特币的Strategy公司周二表示，过去八天内已购入价值约21.3亿美元的比特币。尽管加密货币波动导致其股价承压，该公司仍持续增持比特币。【原文：Billionaire Michael Saylor's bitcoin-focused firm Strategy said on Tuesday it bought about $2.13 billion worth ​of bitcoin over the past eight days, ‌stepping up purchases even as its stock has been pressured by cryptocurrency volatility.】

item.title: 罗氏旗下基因泰克公司将北卡罗来纳州工厂的投资额增至约20亿美元，增幅超过一倍。
item.description: 罗氏旗下基因泰克公司周二宣布，将把在北卡罗来纳州生物制造工厂的初始投资额增加一倍以上，增至约20亿美元。该公司正计划进一步扩大其在美国500亿美元的投资规模。【原文：Roche's Genentech said on Tuesday it will more than double its initial investment in a biomanufacturing facility in North Carolina to about $2 billion, as the companies look to further boost their $50 billion investment in the U.S.】

item.title: 美国邮政服务公司开通末端配送准入竞标平台
item.description: 美国邮政局周二宣布，将推出一个招标网站，征集接入其末端配送网络的提案，向更广泛的客户群体开放全国18,000多个目的地配送单元和本地处理中心。【原文：The U.S. Postal Service said on Tuesday it is launching a bidding site to take proposals for access to its last‑mile delivery network, opening more than 18,000 destination delivery units and local processing centers nationwide to a broader range of customers.】

item.title: 卡塔尔投资局与高盛计划扩大合作，投资目标达250亿美元
item.description: 卡塔尔投资局与高盛集团周二发表声明称，双方已签署谅解备忘录以扩大战略合作，投资目标达250亿美元。【原文：Qatar Investment Authority and Goldman Sachs have signed an MoU to expand their strategic partnership, with a $25 billion investment target, a statement said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国总统特朗普提出的应对生活成本的方案
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普在面临今年国会选举前解决选民负担能力的压力下，近期推出多项重大政策提案，旨在提高住房拥有率并控制生活成本。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump, under pressure to address voter affordability concerns ahead of congressional elections this year, has recently pushed a number of major policy proposals aimed at boosting home ownership and reining in living costs.】

item.title: 波动率指标飙升，关税威胁令投资者惊慌失措
item.description: 周二，随着特朗普总统威胁重启与欧洲的贸易战，股市、美国长期国债和美元大幅下跌，各类资产的波动率指标均出现上升。【原文：Volatility measures across asset classes rose on Tuesday as stocks, U.S. long-dated Treasuries, ‌and the U.S. dollar sold off sharply after President Donald Trump threatened to rekindle a trade war with Europe.】

item.title: 花旗集团首席执行官预计国会不会批准信用卡利率上限
item.description: 花旗集团首席执行官简·弗雷泽周二表示，她不认为国会会批准特朗普总统提议的信用卡利率上限。【原文：Citigroup CEO Jane Fraser said on Tuesday she does not expect Congress to approve caps on credit card interest rates as suggested by president Donald Trump.】

item.title: 日本抛售潮、格陵兰担忧在负债累累的全球债券市场引发连锁反应
item.description: 日本借贷成本飙升至历史新高，周二引发全球主要债券市场动荡。正值市场担忧格陵兰岛相关紧张局势之际，此次波动凸显了债券市场对财政支出增加和高债务水平的脆弱性。【原文：A surge in Japan's borrowing costs to record highs rippled out across major bond markets on Tuesday, just as markets ​fretted over tensions related to Greenland, highlighting their vulnerability to increased fiscal spending and high debt.】

item.title: 关税开始推高产品价格，亚马逊首席执行官告诉CNBC
item.description: 亚马逊公司首席执行官安迪·贾西周二向CNBC透露，随着卖家应对美国总统特朗普关税政策带来的成本压力，该电商平台上的商品价格正开始出现上涨趋势。【原文：Amazon.com is starting to see an uptick in product prices on its e-commerce platform as sellers respond to cost pressures stemming from U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs, the tech giant's CEO, Andy Jassy, told CNBC on Tuesday.】

item.title: 人工智能初创公司Humans&在种子轮融资中以45亿美元估值筹集4.8亿美元资金。
item.description: 人工智能初创公司Humans&周二宣布，已完成4.8亿美元种子轮融资，公司估值达44.8亿美元。该公司由前OpenAI、Alphabet和xAI研究人员共同创立。【原文：AI startup Humans&, founded by former OpenAI, Alphabet ​and xAI researchers, has raised $480 million in a seed financing ‌round, which values the company at $4.48 billion, it said on Tuesday.】

item.title: Substack挑战者beehiiv预计在通讯热潮中收入将近翻倍
item.description: Beehiiv首席执行官兼联合创始人泰勒·登克独家向路透社透露，随着这家电子通讯初创企业向规模更大的竞争对手Substack发起挑战，争夺蓬勃发展的创作者经济份额，该公司预计今年年收入将近乎翻倍，达到5000万美元。【原文：Beehiiv expects to nearly double annual revenue to $50 million this year as the newsletter startup challenges larger rival Substack for a share of the booming creator economy, its CEO and co-founder Tyler Denk exclusively told Reuters.】

item.title: 流媒体在12月占据美国近半数电视收视份额，《怪奇物语》助推增长
item.description: 尼尔森公司周二发布的数据显示，流媒体服务在去年12月占据了美国近半数电视收视份额，这主要得益于Netflix在圣诞节当天播出的NFL赛事以及万众期待的《怪奇物语》最终季。【原文：Streaming services captured nearly half of all television viewership in the U.S. in December, powered by Netflix's Christmas Day NFL games and the highly anticipated final season of "Stranger Things," audience measurement firm Nielsen reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 独家：德国TKMS公司寻求投资方案，力争赢得加拿大120亿美元潜艇招标项目
item.description: 德国战舰制造商TKMS公司首席执行官表示，该公司正与挪威和德国企业洽谈，计划在竞争激烈的加拿大潜艇招标中提交价值数十亿美元的投资方案，以期击败韩国竞争对手的投标。【原文：Warship builder TKMS is in talks with Norwegian and German companies to offer a multi-billion dollar investment package to Canada in a fiercely competitive submarine tender, its CEO said, hoping to beat a rival South Korean bid.】

item.title: 爱丁堡环球股东否决萨巴资本提出的董事会重组方案
item.description: 爱丁堡环球投资信托公司周二表示，其股东已否决了最大股东萨巴资本提出的全部决议，这些决议旨在更换公司整个董事会。【原文：Edinburgh Worldwide Investment Trust said on Tuesday its shareholders have rejected all resolutions proposed by top shareholder Saba Capital to replace its entire board.】

item.title: 丹麦养老基金将撤资其持有的美国国债
item.description: 丹麦养老基金AkademikerPension周二表示，将在本月底前抛售其持有的美国国债，价值约1亿美元，并指责美国政府财政状况疲软。【原文：Danish pension fund AkademikerPension said ‌on Tuesday it would sell off its holding of U.S. Treasuries, worth some $100 million, by the end of this month, blaming ‌weak U.S. government finances.】
